Under this my good woman’s ^nurse’s care I ran
wild about our park and the neighbouring
fields. which were The offspring of the
deepest love I displayed from my earli
-est years the greatest sensibility in of
my disposition. I cannot say with what
passion I loved every thing even the
inanimate of objects that surrounded
me. I believe that I bore an indivi
dual attatchment to every tree in our
park; every animal that inhabited it
knew me and I loved them. Their occa
